definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

sentences.english: Australian beef tenderloin, truffle mashed potato, roasted vegetables, red wine sauce.
sentences.chinese: 澳洲牛里脊，松露土豆泥，烤时蔬，红酒汁。

sentences.english: Wrap each piece of pork fillet in pastry to enclose.
sentences.chinese: 一张生面皮包一个肉里脊，要全部裹好，封实。

sentences.english: Roast Wagu Beef, Mushroom Salad, Mashed Potato, Beef Sauce.
sentences.chinese: 香烤和牛里脊，鲜菌，土豆泥，牛肉汁。
牛里脊肉还是肉眼牛排？

sentences.english: This wine is best paired with Pasta Bolognese or spicy pork tenderloin with wilted arugula.
sentences.chinese: 配搭肉酱意大利面条或辣味里脊猪肉。

sentences.english: If you prefer, use strips of pork tenderloin instead of beef.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愿意，可以用片状的猪肉里脊代替牛肉。

sentences.english: She had two big packages of sirloin strips in her purse.
sentences.chinese: 她把两大盒牛里脊肉条藏在钱包里。

sentences.english: Pork loin is very lean meat and isn't too expensive.
sentences.chinese: 猪里脊肉是瘦肉，并且不贵。

sentences.english: Jirou in the meat will be cut into thin slices.
sentences.chinese: 将里脊肉肉片切成为薄片。
